TopicTitle: What is lost reverting a flight in career mode?

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I'm starting playing Kerbal Space Program now and I'm loving it! However, I'm failing miserably to achieve some of the contracts. So, that why I have the question: what is lost reverting a flight in career mode? Reputation? Money?

Thanks,
Davi

Moved to Gameplay Questions because of gameplay question 

 

And I usually don't allow myself the option to revert flights in my actual career mode games, so I don't know... As far as I know, however, I don't think anything is lost. Not entirely sure, though.

Hi Maximus97,

Thanks for fixing my post!

About not reverting in career mode, if I tried this way I would be without astronauts or money at this point...

Regards,
Davi

Reverting is exactly like restoring from a quicksave, because that's essentially what is done.

When you revert to launch, it's like the previous launch NEVER HAPPENED because it DID NOT HAPPEN in that save.

When you revert to VAB, it's like you never even rolled the ship out for the same reason.

Edited March 30, 2016 by 5thHorseman

Hi guys,

Thanks for the quick answers! By the way, I just watched your video riding the asteroid.

Regards,
Davi
